results.title: Head of Finance
results.description:
Legl is a fast-growing, vertical B2B SaaS platform with a mission to bring the legal industry into the 21st century. We closed our Series B (May 2022), and we are scaling quickly on our next phase of growth.

Our vision is to be part of a structural change in the legal industry so that firms, as well as their clients, have a better experience of accessing legal services. We launched in October 2019 and in the short time since then have built a large law firm customer base who love our product and our team.

We have an agile, ambitious and collaborative team. With deep experience across design, tech and the industry, we put our employees first. We‚Äôre looking for people who can grow with us.

Our core values are agility, ambition, and collaboration. We rely heavily on data and first principles decision-making.

The Role

As part of Legl‚Äôs ambitious plans for the future, we are recruiting for a Head of Finance to enable the evolution of our financial operations. Owning all finance functions and managing our finance team, the Head of Finance will collaborate with senior leadership stakeholders by providing insights and detailed analysis of financial reporting. As an experienced finance operator, you‚Äôll fine-tune our finance processes, own our controls and partner with leadership to understand and model business performance.

Joining a remote-first team built on collaboration and passion, our Head of Finance will be instrumental to the success of our scaling plans. Embedding yourself as part of the positive culture, you will enable change management internally as Legl drives transformation in the legal industry.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Process and controls: Review, refine and implement necessary controls and safeguards to support scaling processes and enable smooth business operations.
  • Accounts and filing: Own the preparation of monthly financial reports and accounts, as well as all regulatory submissions and filing deadlines.
  • Financial Planning & Analysis: Provide senior stakeholders with detailed financial analysis, forecasting, budgeting and cash flow management.
  • Team leadership: Responsibility for the management and professional development of our finance team.
  • Audit: Lead on the process to deliver a successful audit, interfacing with external auditors.
  • Transformation: Upgrading our finance processes and driving change management to enable our team to work in a highly efficient manner.

Requirements

  • Chartered Accountant: Proven experience (ideally 4 years + PQE) delivering commercial impact within a fast paced start up, scaleup or tech business.
  • Industry Embedded: Experience in the software / technology industry
  • Knowledgeable: Excellent understanding of accounting standards (FRS 102 & IFRS)
  • Passion For Reporting: Strong skills, and a genuine passion, for reporting and analytics
  • Excellent Communicator: Outstanding communication / interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and express complex issues succinctly and clearly
  • Pride & Ownerships: Able to deliver against complex, or multi-stage requirements, and take ownership for project outcomes and deliverables
  • Automation & Tech Focused: Advanced Excel/Google Sheets knowledge with familiarity working with BI tools

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and share options: we all share in Legl‚Äôs success
  • Legl has a dynamic, remote-first culture, with a focus on making work work for you. We give generous budgets for home set-ups, co-working space use if you need or want it and access to office spaces for collaboration in person, no matter where you live.
  • Twice-annual offsites to get to socialise with your colleagues in person.
  • Opportunity to join a well-funded, post-Series B startup in our mission to make legal services better for everyone
  • High impact work that really matters - success in this role will drive our growth and have a big impact on the business and our clients
  • A focus on wellbeing with access to support sessions with a psychotherapist and a personal wellbeing budget of ¬£250 per year
  • A learning and development budget of ¬£1000 per year
  • Regular company off-sites, where we all get together in-person, as well as frequent remote social events

Diversity

We believe that having diverse teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

results.title: (Senior) Data Engineer (m/f/x)
results.description:

¬†

  • Be part of one of the fastest-growing and most visible Fintech startups in Europe, creating innovative services that have a substantial impact on the lives of our customers

results.description:
About Tymit

At Tymit our mission is to give people the self-confidence to live life to the fullest by offering them credit that's smart, flexible and honest.

That's why we launched the world's first installment credit card ‚Äì and why we're now partnering with only the most iconic brands to bring the next generation of installment experiences to their customers.

We believe that everyone deserves financial peace of mind, that credit should only work for you, and that tech will continue to transform the way to shop, pay and manage our spending.

Our talented and growing team is based in the UK, Spain and Greece, and we're all committed to creating a diverse, fun work environment, with collaboration and the customer at the core of everything we do.

Following our ¬£23m Series A round, closed in October 2021 and led by Frasers Group, we're focused on our next phase of growth - and creating the future of installment experiences.

Compensation & Perks

üí∞ The salary range of this role is 35,000‚Ç¨ ‚Äì 48,000‚Ç¨ per annum, depending on experience.

üèù 25 days of paid holiday plus bank holidays.

üåá If your preference is working from our office and working onsite with other Tymiteers, we have you covered with our offices - Postpandemic.

‚è∞ Flexible working hours.

ü§ì Additional days to attend conferences and workshops related to technology and/or events related to Tymit‚Äôs industry and sector.

üí≤ Budget for remote home expenses.

üìö Learning & Development is a big asset for us, and we count with a yearly budget.

üè• Private health insurance.

üë©üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë©üèª Referral program.

üí≥ 6 months free-interest for all Tymiteers in our Tymit card.

üíª Budget for your home office set up.

About the role

We are looking for a talented and dedicated QA Engineer to build the safest credit card in the market. Our tech team is growing ‚Äì and learning as we go. We‚Äôre on a journey, building and evolving the way we work, and we‚Äôre looking for recruits who can teach us as much as we‚Äôll teach them.

Joining our engineering team, and you work cross-platform, testing on both our iOS and Android applications. We have a product-oriented team, releasing apps every week. The ideal candidate is mobile-savvy, loves testing, and understands what makes a great mobile app!

About the culture

Be ready to join a company where collaboration is key. You will be expected to share knowledge and speak up, at the same time you have the ability to listen to others and consider their opinions. At Tymit we are also big fans of good atmosphere and humor, prepare yourself to receive a bunch of GIFs.

QA Engineers at Tymit work by squads in cross-functional teams, applying good practices and agile methodologies. Within the team, you will find Angela, Sebas, Christos and Mariano.

During your time at Tymit you will

  • Work as part of cross-functional, friendly, agile tech teams to ensure quality is driven into the development process.
  • Test new features and ensure that existing features are working well.
  • Ensure that tests are executed and give regular feedback to the team on the status of quality.
  • Help to configure test environments for both manual and automated tests.
  • Find bugs and analyze the importance and priority of bugs relating to a release.
  • Write clear bug reports and provide all the necessary detail so that others can reproduce and diagnose the issue.
  • Play a part in clarifying business requirements and user stories.
  • Work with Product, Tech, and Ops teams to ensure applications are tested to the defined acceptance level.
  • Bear in mind both verification and validation for the product.
  • Collaborate on the definition of process. Actively provides improvement feedback on current processes.
  • Push improvement for automation across the testing pyramid.
  • Consider best practices, design patterns, code smells for the automation code and the reviews.
  • Instructs, mentors and coaches to develop a QA mindset to other QAs and tech roles.
  • Collaborate in the metric definition and implementation.

Key technologies we use at Tymit

Software Engineer in Test team: you will be working with technologies such as Xcode, Android Studio, JMeter, Xray, Appium, Selenium, TestProject, Taurus, Slack and Jira.

Tymit tech team: we work with technologies such as Kotlin, SwiftUI, Swift, Java, Groovy, Grails, Quarkus, NodeJS, React, Python, RabbitMQ, Postgres, AWS, ELK, Docker, Docker Swarm, Terraform, Ansible, and Jenkins.

We are always open to adopting new tools to solve complex problems, so we‚Äôre ready to discuss options with anyone with the right experience.

Know your path within Tymit...

1 month

Taking off!

You will meet other Tymiteers and their roles in the guild and squad, looking at the tools, processes, ceremonies, stack, stakeholders, etc. Also, where to find out the documentation and what are the development processes with all its conventions. Start participating in the team culture and the recurring meetings of the QA team and squad, such as retros, syncs, and internal learning sessions, so you get familiar with the format.

You will be able to start pulling the thread, looking at possible improvements and things you may want to take on later. You will understand the scale and impact of our business.

3 months

Dig in!

You will have ventured into all squads and worked cross-functionally with Product Managers, Engineers, and Designers enough to understand requirements, provide technical insights. You will be familiar enough with the structure of our project to be able to start proposing improvements. Do manual test across different layers, define test plans, define test cases, start identifying risks.

6 months

Push up!

You will be a crucial member of the team. So, your contributions and proposals will bring tremendous value to the business and help other more junior team members grow. You will have a vision of the roadmap and the priorities to make Tymit‚Äôs tech scalable. You will be working with the broader engineering team to enhance, document, establish processes and improve the app's design and functionalities. Coordinates the execution of test sessions, detect and rise risks during the SDLC, collaborates on the definition of process, drive POCs for automation initiatives.

What you will bring along

  • Hands-on experience in testing mobile apps.
  • Previous experience using Xcode/Android studio, Espresso, Charles Proxy, or any other proxy tool.
  • Exposure to automated testing tools, e.g. Appium, Robot Framework, Playwright, Protractor, Test sigma, Katalon Studio, Selenium, Cucumber, etc.
  • Experience working with API automation frameworks or tools, e.g.: REST Assured, Postman, etc.
  • Passionate about all things mobile and apps.
  • Pragmatic when raising bugs and understand the importance of meeting release deadlines.
  • Clear communicator, fluent in English.
  • Holistic thinking and focus on small, intricate details essential for the high-impact role you will play at Tymit.

What you can expect from our hiring process

Stage 1

45 min. video-call with Carla, part of Tymit‚Äôs People team. Understand your career plan and what motivates you about Tymit.

Stage 2

60 min. video-call with Mariano, QA Lead. Brief technical discussion to understand more about the role and your skills.

Stage 3

90 min. video-call with Angela and Christos, both QA Engineers. Technical discussion around a task to better understand your skills and give you a sneak peek of what it could be working at Tymit.

Stage 4

60 min. video-call with two other engineers from our Engineering team. Technical discussion with your future team and introduction to Tymit‚Äôs culture.

Stage 5

üèÅ‚Äì Offer üìß

If you have any disability, please let us know whether there are any adjustments we can make for our process to be more inclusive.

To meet our regulatory obligations as a licensed financial services company in the UK, Tymit needs to take background checks, Criminal and Credit checks, our new hires to help us safeguard our users. If you have any concerns regarding this process, please discuss this with our People Team.

Tymit is made up of people from various backgrounds, and you are welcome for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like. We seek to create a culture where everyone can belong because we believe that people do their best work to show up every day as their authentic selves. results.title: Tax Specialist
results.description:
Wade Financial Advisory (www.wadefa.com) is seeking a Tax Specialist for our fee-only financial planning and investment advisory firm in Campbell, CA. We help manage every aspect of our client's financial life, partnering, educating, and guiding them throughout the process to help them make well-informed financial decisions. We are looking for a Tax Specialist to join our firm to lead our tax team in tax planning and return preparation. We are open to this position being permanently remote, but we are also interviewing local applicants.

Salary and Benefits

  • Salary will be $80,000 - $100,000 based on experience, a healthcare allowance, life/disability insurance, and a 401(k) with matching contributions.
  • We are currently working remotely and we will continue to follow state and CDC guidelines but this position can be remote permanently.
  • Upbeat, collegial, and professional working environment

Duties Include:

  • Participation and leadership in client meetings that have tax planning or review focus
  • Preparation or review of tax planning projections for the majority of clients throughout the year with the follow-up to clients on crucial issues and tasks
  • Manage and improve the firm's processes around tax planning and preparation
  • Research of tax treatment of unusual prior or contemplated transactions or expenses
  • Preparation and review of client tax returns
  • Respond to audit notices and requests for information from various tax authorities

Requirements

  • CPA or EA or have MS in Tax, as well as a minimum of three years of tax preparation and planning experience. CFP, CPA, PFS credentials are a plus.
  • Advance individual tax knowledge, as well as basic experience with corporate, partnership, trust, gift, and benefit (5500EZ) returns.
  • Experience with Lacerte, as well as Quickbooks and Quicken will be beneficial, but not required.

The Process

Qualified candidates will start the process by having a 15-30 minute phone interview conducted by our consultant who is the hiring manager for this position. If there is ground to move forward, you will be required to fill out a Career History Form and if you are selected to advance in the process, you will meet with the firm. Qualified candidates will be asked to take assessments. A background and credit check will be required.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Signaloid provides a computing platform to quantify, transmit, and track data uncertainty dynamically and throughout computations in unmodified computing workloads. Our technologies are used in applications including materials modeling, autonomous systems, computational finance, machine learning, and noisy intermediate-scale quantum computing. Our team consists of contrarian engineers with combined research, engineering, and leadership experience from Apple, ARC, ARM, Bell Labs, CMU, University of Cambridge, EPFL, IBM Research, Max Planck, MIT, and NEC Labs. Find out more at https://signaloid.com and try out the Signaloid uncertainty-tracking computing platform by signing up for free at https://get.signaloid.io.

¬†

Role Description

In this role, you will work closely with the founder and CEO, supporting them operationally to deliver Signaloid's long-term vision through execution of our medium-term mission and strategies.

To succeed in this role, you will be someone who brings to the team the following attributes:

  • A self-motivated individual with a desire to learn about and contribute to supporting the CEO and executive team of a fast-paced technology startup.
  • An ability to take initiatives while actively working to understand the reality and constraints of your environment.

In this role, you will need to continuously grow your ability to achieve objectives including:

  • Continually improve your ability to identify the importance and urgency of tasks on the plate of both the CEO and the CEO's direct reports.
  • Always be willing to ask questions when in doubt and listen to all verbal and non-verbal cues in communications, to identify when you need to ask questions to find out more.
  • Build trust from the CEO and executive team, through your demonstration of success in identifying challenges that can be taken off the CEO's plate and resolving those challenges with the collaboration of relevant team members.
  • Participate with the CEO in all internal and external communications and implement and achieve continuous improvement in the effectiveness and efficiency of those communications.

Within a year in this role, you can expect to:

  • Grow the remit of your responsibilities.
  • Contribute to the company's strategic operations.
  • Lead strategic initiatives within the company.
  • Have the opportunity to contribute to and explore other opportunities within Signaloid based on your demonstrated performance.

Requirements

  • Demonstrable exceptional written communication in English
  • Demonstrable ability to understand and communicate technical topics to laypersons (you do not necessarily need an Engineering or Science degree)
  • Demonstrable understanding of Signaloid‚Äôs products based on the publicly-available information and from using our shipping products
  • Demonstrable knowledge of and ability to apply, known methods for categorizing and prioritizing tasks in a fast-paced high-consequence environment
  • Excellent facility with text processing, presentation, and graphic design and illustration tools
  • A willingness to listen to people until they feel understood
  • Honesty, empathy, and a willingness to see the world from the viewpoint of others

Additional Desirable Skills and Experience:

  • Working knowledge of at least one additional spoken language
  • Familiarity with GitHub‚Äôs project management tools
Our Recruiting Procedure
  • All positions require you to write a one-page cover letter (you can also substitute the cover letter for a snippet of code that will run on the signaloid.io platform; be creative!). We use the cover letter to screen for communication skills, as clear communication is essential in a remote working environment.
  • Applicants who pass the cover letter screening receive an initial 15-minute Zoom screening call with a member of our People Development Team to discuss your CV.
  • Applicants who pass the screening interview, regardless of the position they are interviewing for, will be given a real-world project to solve over the course of one week (or two weeks if you are currently employed in a full-time job). In exchange for your time, we give you two books relevant to the rest of the interview process and ¬£500 worth of free credits on the Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform.
  • Applicants who successfully complete the project are invited for a set of 45-minute interviews with people from our core teams (there will be up to six such interviews) which will use the project you completed as a discussion point.
  • In the final stage, applicants are invited for an on-site interview with members of the team in Cambridge.

Benefits

A flexible remote-first work environment

  • Be part of an international team with the flexibility to choose where you live
  • You can work any set of eight hours in a day provided four of those hours overlap with the working day in Zurich
  • Join the rest of the team every three months for an in-person session somewhere in Europe

Competitive compensation

  • Yearly bonus based on company's Objectives and Key Results (OKR) performance and bi-yearly bonus based on your project team's OKR performance
  • Simple transparent compensation across the company, with four pay levels, in all roles, based on skill level: Contributor, Senior Contributor, Lead Contributor, and Principal Contributor
  • All full-time employees receive attractive stock options package

results.title: Enterprise Technical Success Manager

The team is responsible for ensuring customers are appreciating maximum value from our platform, and identifying ways we can help a customer solve business problems. In terms of growth, we truly believe in the continued development of each new hire. In joining this team, you‚Äôll take part in a community that believes in development and promotion from within and as a rapidly growing business, there are a lot of opportunities for progression.

What you‚Äôll do:
  • Own an assigned book of accounts with a focus on onboarding, driving product usage, growing engagement and ensuring retention
  • Educate customers on new and existing features, strategizing on how to optimize their use of the product and services to drive significant business value
  • Identify both business and technical use cases and partner with the customer to build a mutual success plan to help accomplish those objectives
  • Lead executive business reviews with customers by presenting usage data, performance metrics, business outcomes, and recommendations
  • Partner with Account Executives to identify expansion opportunities within your portfolio

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

About CircleCI

CircleCI is the world‚Äôs largest shared continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools - processing more than 1 million builds a day - CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by Base10, Greenspring Associates, Eleven Prime, IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Baseline Ventures, Threshold Ventures, Scale Venture Partners, Owl Rock Capital, Next Equity Partners, Heavybit and Harrison Metal Capital.

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Salary Range: $110,000 - $130,000

results.title: Head of Ad Sales
results.description:
Likewise is a media and entertainment platform providing personalized content recommendations and discovery for TV, Movies, Books and Podcasts. We have the largest entertainment and media focused newsletters available anywhere. Our newsletters complement our existing product ecosystem of mobile apps, streaming TV guides on the web, and connected TV apps, and they have more than 5M subscriptions.

Reporting to the Head of Business Development and Partnerships, the Head of Ad Sales will build and execute on a robust digital ad sales strategy to monetize Likewise‚Äôs growing email newsletter business. You will partner with leading entertainment marketers to effectively launch and scale a key new revenue product for Likewise, building on our highly-engaged audience in the entertainment space.

Please note: We have four separate ads posted for this same job, in order to be sure the ads show up in each geographical market. We are just hiring one Head of Ad Sales.

Responsibilities:

  • Deliver immediate revenue against target plan
  • Create and build relationships at key entertainment marketers, leading marketers from other relevant categories, and associated media agencies
  • Ensure Likewise‚Äôs email newsletters are top-of-mind during key planning and buying cycles
  • Successfully pitch and win new clients; grow existing revenue from current clients
  • Take a new product to market successfully
  • Compellingly articulate the benefits and unique features of a scaled email newsletter product
  • Create marketing and advertising industry awareness of Likewise broadly and its email newsletter offerings specifically
  • Evangelize the benefits of email newsletters generally and Likewise‚Äôs entertainment-focused offering as a unique, standalone product
  • Help define and create strategic and highly polished pitch collateral
  • Help define advertising products, reporting processes, operational guidelines, pricing & inventory and all other aspects of ad sales process
  • Partner with editorial team around calendar, sponsorable features
  • Represent Likewise at advertising industry events

Requirements

  • 10+ years in a leading ad sales organization from digital publishing, TV sales, digital sales, social / search
  • Experience and, ideally, expertise in selling email newsletter products specifically ‚Äì either as a standalone or as part of a broader portfolio of sales products
  • Ability to manage short & long term revenue targets
  • Deep understanding of marketer and client needs and campaign objectives
  • Network of leading marketers and agencies contacts, ideally from the entertainment category, but also from CPG, Beauty, Auto, Health and other relevant categories
  • Ability to work in unstructured, start-up culture
  • Proven senior level experience in sales
  • Excellent organizational and leadership skills
  • Ability to compellingly pitch deals, structure and negotiate, and close partnerships
  • Self-starter, entrepreneurial, scrappy, nose for deals & dollars
  • Experience managing people and teams
  • Travel to client meetings as needed
  • Strong written, communication and presentation skills
  • MBA preferred

Benefits

In the spirit of pay transparency, we are pleased to share the base salary range for this position is $145K to $205K with significant commission potential over and above base. If you are hired at Likewise, your compensation will be determined based on factors that may include including geographic location, skills, education, and experience. In addition to these factors, we believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current team members as a part of any offer. Please bear in mind that the range listed is the full base salary range for the role, and hiring at the top of the range would not be typical, in order to allow for future salary growth. The range listed is just one component of Likewise‚Äôs total compensation, which includes: PTO; paid holidays; medical, dental, vision, life, and AD&D insurance; employee assistance program; 401k; professional development; paid parental leave; and stock options. Certain revenue-generating positions may be eligible for commission and/or other incentive compensation.

We support workplace diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class.

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About Mangomint

Mangomint is a fast-growing Series A stage SaaS company on a mission to provide next-generation software that embeds so seamlessly into the day-to-day activities of salons and spas, that it effectively disappears. Our platform is used (and loved!) daily by more than 10,000 salon and spa professionals in the U.S. and Canada to handle everything from appointment booking, staff management, payment processing, and so much more.

Backed by one of the leading product-led growth VCs, you can be sure the opportunity to work at Mangomint is filled with possibilities.

We‚Äôre still a pretty small team but we‚Äôre doing really BIG things. We‚Äôre a fully remote, fun and hard-working team with the occasional in-person meetup every few months. Come build with us!


About the Role

Our ideal Product Marketing Manager is a growth-minded, customer journey obsessed self-starter who has deep experience collaborating with product, marketing, sales and customer success teams to develop GTM strategy, perfect product positioning and drive customer acquisition, adoption and expansion.

As our first dedicated product marketing hire, this role will lead the charge in driving core product marketing functions ‚Äî think product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc. ‚Äî and also work closely with product and engineering to identify, test and implement in-product growth levers.

This role sits at the intersection of product, product marketing and growth in a strong PLG-focused organization and is the perfect opportunity for a nimble and analytical rising growth leader.

What you‚Äôll be doing

  • Own core product marketing functions including product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc.
  • Lead the growth charge; strategize and execute on growth experiments and in-product loops that drive signups, usage, and retention
  • Measure the effectiveness of product marketing and growth efforts; connect impact to key business metrics
  • Analyze data to pinpoint high impact opportunities and manage prioritization of future experiments and initiatives
  • Build messaging and positioning for Mangomint products that clearly communicates our competitive advantage in the market
  • Intimately understand our market, customers and competitive landscape; you are the voice of the customer
  • Optimize the full customer journey to maximize user experience and adoption (especially the free trial process)
  • Work collaboratively with product, marketing, sales, customer success and other internal teams
  • Influence strategy for and manage growth-oriented product roadmap initiatives
  • Help build cross-functional product management and product marketing processes at scale

Requirements

  • 2+ years of hands-on product marketing and/or growth marketing experience in B2B SaaS
  • Deep knowledge of product-led growth strategy and tactics; ability to look at all opportunities, experiments and initiatives through a PLG lens
  • Data obsessed with analytical mindset; organized in planning, executing and tracking performance
  • Strong testing mentality and ability to be analytical in everything you do
  • Extensive experience with product marketing functions like product launches, enablement, market research, ICP development, etc.
  • Exceptional ability to write product messaging that communicates value and connects to the market‚Äôs needs
  • Deep customer empathy and ability to impact experience across full customer journey
  • Proficiency with marketing and analytics tools (Segment, Mixpanel, Intercom, marketing automation, in-app messaging, CRM, etc.)
  • Strong project management skills, including ability prioritize high impact activities and move complex project forward efficiently and effectively
  • Extensive knowledge of SaaS product management processes; has the technical chops to collaborate with engineers
  • Curious, continuous learner who thrives in startup environment

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous monthly wellness budget for gym memberships, yoga, spas, etc.
  • Premium subscription to the Calm app
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Lots of opportunities for career and personal growth
  • Remote work
  • Competitive compensation
  • Supportive environment with fun and respectful culture
  • 401k (no matching‚Ä¶yet)



Mangomint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability and genetic information (including family medical history).

results.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
results.description:
Are you looking for a Challenge? Looking for an innovative organization and the opportunity to learn and grow professionally? At Terrestris, LLC, we are helping the government create better mission outcomes through better human performance. Our client is looking for an experienced full-time Senior Embedded Software Engineer to join a growing team. In this role, you'll build and deploy high-impact features into clients product suite. Specifically, working on streamlining and extending an existing C/C++ solution, converting portions of it to Golang. You'll play a critical role in designing, building, and delivering the technology stack that:

  • Serves as the bridge between their hardware and the rest of the product ecosystem
  • Composes the drivers and systems software that allow the core engine of our solution to access necessary data
  • Sustains the backend components that capture Operation Technology-based data on the hardware platform

You'll work cross-functionally with product managers and designers to conceive, implement and ship major features. Our client embraces user-centric design because they firmly believe it ultimately leads to the best products. Engineers are key contributors in shaping this design process and you'll be a major factor in generating high-impact products that literally save lives.

They are a collaborative, passionate and driven cadre of cyber security experts. Their engineers are multidisciplinary, and the team is dynamic. They are a growing company focused on helping customer's fleets run smarter and safer by capitalizing on mountains of data resting right about the wheels.

In this role you will be expected to:

  • Interpret requirements and design specifications to develop, debug, test and maintain software solutions deployed against a broad array of platforms, environments and cloud solutions
  • Facilitate architectural designs that meet business requirements, security and quality standards
  • Streamline and extend existing C/C++ based solutions, migrating portions to Golang
  • Mentor team members and peers to continually improve
  • Actively participate in our agile development processes, including the use of Test Driven Development (TDD)
  • Maintain current knowledge of relevant technologies and developments in the software engineering space

We're looking for someone who is/has:

  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent
  • 8+ Years of experience in software development
  • Strong proficiency in at least three (3) of the following:
  • Experience leading a team of software engineers and instilling best practices
  • Deep understanding of software engineering practices and concepts
  • Demonstrated experience with Linux, Make, CMake, autotools, Kconfig , TDD, CI/CD, Docker, Google ProtoBufs, MQTT, Sentry
  • Prior experience with CANbus, MIL-STD-1553, SAE J1939, ASCB, ARINC 429 is extra helpful
  • US Citizenship
  • Active (or ability to hold/obtain) a US Government Top Secret security clearance

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and stock options in a fast-growing startup
  • Employer-paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their families
  • Health Savings Account with annual employer contributions
  • 401k with employer contributions
  • Employer-paid Life Insurance
  • Uncapped paid time off policy
  • Flexible work & remote work policy
  • Tax-deferred public transit benefits with Metro SmartBenefits (DC/MD/VA)

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that embraces the diversity of our people and represents the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems. We strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, marital status, ancestry, projected veteran status, or any other protected group or class.
